description.p: This is an example application how to use the [`youtube-api`](https://github.com/IonicaBizau/youtube-api) library and explore the YouTube API resources.

ol: You need a [Google Account](https://www.google.com/accounts/NewAccount) to access the Google APIs Console, request an API key, and register your application.
[Register your application](https://console.developers.google.com/project) with Google so that it can submit API requests:

ol.p: After registering your application, select **YouTube Data API** as one of the services that your application uses.

ul: Go to the [APIs Console](https://console.developers.google.com/project) and select the project that you just registered.
Click on *APIs & auth* on the left side. Then a dropdown will be opened.
Search for *YouTube Data API v3*, click it and click <kbd>Enable API</kbd>

ol.p: Enter in the downloaded directory and run `npm install`:

ol: Go back in your Google app and click again on *APIs & auth& and then select *Credentials*.

ol.p: Click <kbd>Create new Client ID</kbd>. This will create new OAuth 2.0 credentials:

ul: Product name: what ever you want (e.g. "Youtube API Test")

ul.p: Now you will have to set the auth urls. This test application uses the following urls:

ul: Authorized JavaScript origins: `http://localhost:5000/` (paste it in the first textarea)
Authorized redirect URIs: `http://localhost:5000/oauth2callback` (paste it in the second textarea)

installation.p: OK, at this step you have the credentials (in your Google app). Now you have to use them in this test application:

ol: Open `credentials.json` and replace `yourClientId` with the **client id** and `yourSecretKey` with **client secret** generated previously.
Now you are ready. Start the script (`npm start`) and open `http://localhost:5000`.
